intro: Sebaea erosa, commonly known as the silky sebaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy, glandular stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, and its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, silky hairs. Sebaea erosa is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in warm, sunny conditions. It is also used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
